comments.body: I'm not sure if it's right or not. From current architecture, named export `addReadme` is imported from `storybook-readme` or `storybook-readme/html`. Problem is when I had to write a test on this. Since it is a type definition, it looks fine... or maybe not. What do you think? Should I use another test files for this?

I don't entirely understand. Regardless, it sounds like you should be able to write either

```ts
import { addReadme } from 'storybook-readme/html'
// OR
import { addReadme } from 'storybook-readme'
```

It is fine to do that in the same test file as long as you use two different local names, which you did.

Yeah, just explain a little bit more. That two different `addReadme` can't be used at the same time in actual usage. However when I was writing this test, I wanted to verify if newly added `addReadme` from `storybook-readme/html` is importing fine and its imported value(`addReadme`) can be an argument of `addDecorator(addHtmlReadme)`
So as you said, doing like this looks fine. Thanks for the review
